operation.descriptionCdata:
411e2cb8-abf1-442a-a693-abf31df7957d.description=Determines the number of elements in the given JavaScript array. If an element is itself another JavaScript array, it only counts as 1 element; in other
words, it will not expand and count embedded arrays. Null values are also considered to be an element.

Inputs\:
 array - The JavaScript array whose elements will be counted. The operation will return a failure if the array is not a JavaScript array; a normal OO list
 is NOT a JavaScript array.

Responses\:
 success - The array is a valid JavaScript array, and the Result output will be populated with the count of elements in the array.
 failure - The array input does not contain a valid JavaScript array. The result will contain a message to that effect. This will occur if the input
 array is not a valid JavaScript array. For example, if presented with a common list value such as a,b,c it will fail because it lacks the
 enclosing brackets and the quotes around each string element. You may wish to use a tool such as http\://www.jsonlint.com/ to help diagnose
 problems with JavaScript Object Notation.

Results\:
 returnResult - The number of elements in the array. Elements that are themselves arrays only count as a single element.

Examples\:
 The size of [ "apple", "banana" ] is 2.

 The size of [ "apple", "pencil", [ 0, 3, 5, -199 ] ] is 3.

 The size of [ "apple", null, "banana", null ] is 4.

 The size of [] is 0.

The description of the enclosing folder describes the JSON format with examples, and the JSON format is described completely at http\://www.json.org.
operation.name: Array Size
